title: Glencore Approaches Teck Over Its Coal Business
description: The commodities giant is willing to buy Teck’s unit as an alternative to full merger.

title: I-95 Collapses in Philadelphia After Vehicle Fire
description: No injuries were reported, but authorities were still searching for the owner of the vehicle, which may have been a tanker truck.

title: Illumina CEO Francis deSouza Resigns
description: Activist investor Carl Icahn has signaled he wants former CEO Jay Flatley to return to gene-sequencing test maker.

title: Novak Djokovic Wins the French Open, His 23rd Major Title
description: Novak Djokovic won the French Open, setting a record for men’s Grand Slam titles with his 23rd victory.

title: Scotland's Ex-Leader Nicola Sturgeon Arrested in Party Finances Probe
description: The former first minister’s arrest is the latest twist in a scandal that has undermined the Scottish independence movement of which she is a key proponent.

title: Novak Djokovic Stands Atop Tennis Alone. It's Time He Gets His Full Due.
description: With a win at the French, the 36-year-old from Serbia now has 23 major singles titles, the most for any men’s tennis player ever. He’s also on path to another shot at a calendar Grand Slam.

title: Times Square Is a Tourist Hot Spot. Its Small Businesses Are Flailing.
description: Despite a rebound in foot traffic, restaurants and other local shops are struggling to pay the bills.

title: A Strong Trump Indictment---but Is It Strong Enough?
description: The evidence against the former president is powerful, but the jurors aren’t the only ones who will need convincing.

title: That's Smoke, Not Climate Change
description: Canada’s forest fires provide fresh fuel for a familiar simplistic political narrative.

title: Toyota's Dissent and the All-Electric Fantasy
description: California, Washington and asset managers push EV absolutism on auto makers.

title: Russia Arrests American in Moscow on Drug Charges
description: Travis Leake, a musician in Moscow, faces up to 12 years in prison for drug dealing.

title: The Most Clipped and Mailed Article in History
description: ‘I hope they read what I’ve sent, but if not, at least they know that I’m thinking about them.’

title: America vs. the Spread of Nuclear Weapons
description: Washington’s nonproliferation efforts have done much to keep the nuclear peace.

title: Connecticut Could Use Some More Republicans
description: For Democrats, a tax cut is a revelation.

title: The Greatest Threat to Our Forests
description: It isn’t climate change.

title: Would Biden Get Up From a Fall in 2025?
description: He needed help this last time.

title: Trump to Appear in Court in Miami Tuesday Amid Flurry of Probes
description: Law-enforcement officials are bracing for the possibility of unrest as demonstrators both supporting and opposing the former president make plans to rally around the courthouse.

title: CEO Takes Shell's Pitch Direct to Wall Street
description: Wael Sawan signals openness to more oil production in an effort to woo investors.

title: As Bakhmut Collapsed Around Them, This Family Clung On
description: Roman Dmytriev refused to evacuate his family, including two teenage daughters, even as Russia squeezed Ukrainian soldiers out.

title: Auto Parts Maker Resisting Recall Request Had Workplace-Safety Woes
description: ARC Automotive, the Chinese-owned maker of 67 million air-bag inflators that regulators want recalled, has faced safety violations and litigation over allegedly flawed parts.

title: George Soros Hands Control to His 37-Year-Old Son: 'I'm More Political'
description: In his first interview as successor, Alex Soros says the family’s $25 billion philanthropic enterprise will boost its support for voting and abortion rights.

title: How to Tell if You're the Office Jerk
description: It isn’t easy, because people don’t like to give negative feedback. But there are ways to find out—and fix things.

title: More »
description: They asked to see the body tagged No. 177&#x2014;it wasn&#x27;t there. Three days since the crash, the desperate search for their son went on.
